Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Anisaxin-2P (cecropins; natural AMPs; UCLL1, marine parasitic nematode; invertebrates, animals; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (96.77%) toAnisaxin-2SMol formula: C153H261N45O41, Mol Wt: 3397.996; Mol Ex Coeff: 11100; GRAVY:  -0.558.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC, c.i., or c.i.2 (MIC 0.5-2 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC, c.i., c.i.2 (MIC 0.5-2 uM), A. baumannii ATCC, c.i., or c.i.2. (MIC 0.5-1 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC, c.i., or c.i.2 (MIC 4-16 uM), and S. aureus ATCC (MIC 32-64 uM), S-aureus c.i., or c.i.2 (MIC >64 uM). All MBC values are similar to MIC values, indicative of a bactericidal effect.Toxicity:  the concentration that reduced 50% viability of HPBMC >100 uM.  NO vidence for DNA damage.Structure:  the peptide (20 uM) became helical in 50% TFE or 10 mM SDS based on CD studies.
Literature Information.Author: Roncevic T, Gerdol M, Mardirossian M, Male≈° M, Cvjetan S, Benincasa M, Maravic A, Gajski G, Krce L, Aviani I, Hrabar J, Trumbic Z, Derks M, Pallavicini A, Weingarth M, Zoranic L, Tossi A, Mladineo I. 2022
Literature Information.Title: Anisaxins, helical antimicrobial peptides from marine parasites, kill resistant bacteria by lipid extraction and membrane disruption
